(FISH)
Add to word list

pike noun
(WEAPON)
[ C ] plural pikes a long sharp stick used in the past as a weapon by soldiers on foot: A soldier with a pike could bring down a charging horse.
TommL/E+/GettyImages

pike noun
(POSITION)
[ C or U ] plural pikes a position in the sports of diving, trampolining, or gymnastics in which the body is bent at the waist and the legs are straight: Her coach asked her to do a triple pike - a difficult dive to pull off from 10 metres. Their best dive came in the fifth round – a forward 2 and a half somersaults and 3 twists in pike.
CSA-Archive/DigitalVision Vectors/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesWith a pike, you have to keep your legs straight through the whole rotation.The trampoline comes with safety enclosures, so you won't hurt yourself while doing a pike jump. Pike and Tuck positions are common body positions used in various sports.
